entries.title: California declares state of emergency ahead of incoming storm
entries.description: Heavy rainfall expected to cause flooding and power outages across the state, with tornados in other parts of the US.

entries.title: Critically injured US football player shows ‘improvement’
entries.description: Damar Hamlin has received support from players and fans across the country after suffering a cardiac arrest on Monday.

entries.title: Peru roadblocks resume as president urges ‘peace, calm, unity’
entries.description: Protests reignite in Peru after holiday pause, with many demonstrators demanding removal of new President Dina Boluarte.

entries.title: Photos: Europe sees spell of record warm winter temps
entries.description: Ski resorts shut down due to lack of snow as continent records warmest days in January on record.

entries.title: US President Biden touts infrastructure deal in Kentucky visit
entries.description: The Democratic president visited the deep-red state in a push for bipartisanship, alongside Republican Mitch McConnell.

entries.title: Twitter says it will reverse ban on political ads
entries.description: The social media platform tweeted that it would relax its advertising policy for 'cause-based ads' in the US.

entries.title: Can China and the Philippines mend their strained ties?
entries.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr is in China for his first overseas trip as leader.

entries.title: US labour market remains tight, manufacturing slows down
entries.description: Job openings, a measure of labour demand, slipped in November, but there were still more jobs available than expected.

entries.title: China ‘under-representing’ severity of COVID outbreak, says WHO
entries.description: A senior official at the WHO criticised China's 'too narrow' definition for COVID-related deaths.

entries.title: US embassy in Cuba resumes full immigrant visa services
entries.description: Resumption of visa and consular services in Havana comes amid record migration from the Caribbean island to the US.

entries.title: Photos: Experts warn of ecological threat from Mayan Train route
entries.description: Mexico hopes the railway will boost the economy and reduce poverty, despite concerns about its environmental impact.

entries.title: UK PM pledges to tackle inflation and NHS waiting lists
entries.description: Rishi Sunak outlines 'five promises' to voters in bid to restore public confidence in his Conservative Party.

entries.title: Salesforce to cut 10% of workforce in latest tech layoffs
entries.description: It said it needs to cut costs after rapid pandemic hiring left it with 'too many people' amid an economic slowdown.

entries.title: Iran frees actress Taraneh Alidoosti jailed for backing protests
entries.description: Taraneh Alidoosti, star of an Oscar-winning film, was jailed for criticising a crackdown on Mahsa Amini protests.

entries.title: Colombia backtracks on ceasefire announcement with ELN rebels
entries.description: Government's about-face comes after left-wing rebels said they had not discussed a truce with Bogota.

entries.title: Syria opposition uneasy after Turkish outreach to al-Assad regime
entries.description: Turkey says there is no change in its Syria policy after opposition groups urge Ankara to reaffirm support for them.

entries.title: Criticism of Lula’s economic plans mounts as Brazil markets tank
entries.description: Analysts and a leading newspaper have slammed ministers after local markets tanked in Lula's first two days in office.

entries.title: US House impasse: Biden urges Republicans to ‘get act together’
entries.description: Republican leader Kevin McCarthy remains defiant in bid for House speaker as lawmakers prepare for further ballots.

entries.title: Airline trade body slams COVID rules on travellers from China
entries.description: Criticism from International Air Transport Association comes as EU weighs bloc-wide rules on arrivals from China.

entries.title: Kenya Airways shares suspended for yet another year
entries.description: Stocks in indebted airline have not been traded since 2020, and the president says he wants to sell government's stake.

entries.title: Palestinian villagers in Masafer Yatta face immediate expulsion
entries.description: Palestinian residents of Masafer Yatta, in the occupied West Bank, have been told they will be displaced imminently.

entries.title: How we remember them: Celebrating the life of a friend who died
entries.description: In New Orleans, a silversmith’s friends celebrated their life with a party and the knick-knacks they left behind.

entries.title: Putin puts warship armed with hypersonic missiles on combat duty
entries.description: The Admiral Gorshkov frigate will sail to the Atlantic and Indian oceans, Moscow says.

entries.title: Pakistan Taliban threatens top political leadership including PM
entries.description: Latest TTP statement explicitly names Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari.

entries.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka to hold first election since major unrest
entries.description: Local government polls will be held before the end of February, according to officials.

entries.title: Senior Philippine police urged to resign to ‘cleanse’ force
entries.description: Authorities ask hundreds of senior officers to resign in government crackdown on police involved in drugs trade.

entries.title: The menace lurking in Palestine’s beautiful green spaces
entries.description: Settlers are violently blocking Palestinians from accessing the green spaces of the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Disabled people in UK unable to afford heating, food: Report
entries.description: Soaring inflation has forced disabled people already beset by lower incomes to cut back on essentials, study says.

entries.title: The Full Report: Lebanon’s forgotten Palestinians
entries.description: Lebanon’s Palestinians have been hit hard by the country’s economic collapse. They feel trapped and have few options.

entries.title: Archbishop says desecration of Jerusalem cemetery a ‘hate crime’
entries.description: Anglican Archbishop Hosam Naoum says Israel is facing 'religious radicalism' as Christian graves are vandalised.

entries.title: After months of calm, Yemen looks anxiously to the new year
entries.description: A six month truce set the tone for 2022, with Yemen's warring parties largely avoiding direct conflict.

entries.title: Car bombs kills at least nine civilians in central Somalia
entries.description: Al-Shabab is claiming responsibility for two car bombs in Hiraan after it was pushed out of the region.

entries.title: Burkina Faso requests French ambassador withdrawal, Paris says
entries.description: Relations between France and former colony Burkina Faso continue to deteriorate as violence continues in the Sahel.

entries.title: The US is inspiring education censorship elsewhere
entries.description: The US likes to lecture others on democracy and free speech, but is now leading the way on classroom censorship.

entries.title: Missouri carries out first US execution of a transgender person
entries.description: Amber McLaughlin, convicted of murder, was executed by lethal injection after being denied clemency.

entries.title: Myanmar’s military honours anti-Muslim monk, frees prisoners
entries.description: Wirathu has long been known for his ultranationalist, anti-Muslim rhetoric, particularly against Myanmar’s Rohingya.

entries.title: Taiwan to give cash payouts to citizens in ‘New Year blessing’
entries.description: Premier Su Tseng-chang says 'fruit of economic achievements will be shared by all citizens'.

entries.title: UAE, China call for UN meeting over Ben-Gvir’s Al-Aqsa visit
entries.description: The UN Security Council is expected to convene on Thursday, according to diplomats.

entries.title: US FDA allows sale of abortion pills at pharmacies for first time
entries.description: Regulatory change to expand abortion access comes after more than a dozen states banned abortion.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 315
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 315th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Google accuses India watchdog of copy-pasting EU’s Android ruling
entries.description: Tech giant argues a $161m fine for exploiting the market dominance of its Android operating system should be quashed.

entries.title: New Zealand won’t require visitors from China to show COVID test
entries.description: 'There is minimal public health risk to New Zealand,' COVID-19 minister Ayesha Verrall said of visitors from China.

entries.title: Two Pakistan intelligence officers gunned down in Punjab province
entries.description: Slain officers were known for their work tracking down members of Pakistan's Taliban and solving complex armed attacks.

entries.title: Military-ruled Myanmar marks 75 years independent of Britain
entries.description: Tanks rolled out for independence celebration just days after jailing of country's democracy icon Aung San Suu Kyi.

entries.title: ‘Majority’ of EU states back COVID test for travellers from China
entries.description: European Commission says most member countries favour pre-departure testing amid surging cases in China.

entries.title: Ex-GE worker jailed for plotting to steal trade secrets for China
entries.description: New York man had been convicted of conspiracy to commit economic espionage following a four-week trial in March.

entries.title: Russia now says 89 killed in Ukraine attack, blames mobile phones
entries.description: Ukraine claims that about 400 Russian soldiers were killed in a raid on military quarters in Makiivka on Sunday.

entries.title: Republican Mitch McConnell breaks US Senate leadership record
entries.description: McConnell has become the longest serving Senate leader in the chamber's history as the 118th US Congress convenes.
